item.title: Help! 100 errors!
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You have one too many brackets after the if statement.

         addItem(6739, 1);
         addItem(7158, 1);
      }
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("smoke")&& playerRights >= 3)
{
            stillGfx(188, absY, absX);
         }

if (command.startsWith("boom") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Soal Reaver"))
{
            stillgfx(572, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
            stillgfx(571, absY, absX); //Dust storm
            stillgfx(582, absY+1, absX+1);
            stillgfx(498, absY+4, absX-1); //498 = Fireball

Read full topic

item.title: Help! 100 errors!
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

Here try this

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("smoke")&& playerRights >= 3){ stillgfx(188, absY, absX); } if (command.startsWith("boom") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Soal Reaver")) { stillgfx(572, absY, absX); //Hole in ground stillgfx(571, absY, absX); //Dust storm stillgfx(582, absY+1, absX+1); stillgfx(498, absY+4, absX-1); //498 = Fireball }
Make sure you don’t accidentally put over the addItem because I didn’t add it in there

EDIT:
Since you might want to know what was wrong I will show you

[code] }
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“smoke”)&& playerRights >= 3){
{
stillGfx(188, absY, absX);
}

if (command.startsWith(“boom”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Soal Reaver”))
{
stillgfx(572, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
stillgfx(571, absY, absX); //Dust storm
stillgfx(582, absY+1, absX+1);
stillgfx(498, absY+4, absX-1); //498 = Fireball[/code]
Ok so that was your code I will show you each place you should fix

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“smoke”)&& playerRights >= 3){
{
stillGfx(188, absY, absX);
}

if (command.startsWith(“boom”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Soal Reaver”))[/code]
You didn’t need the bracket down one line from the command smoke, and you have a space after you bracket under stillGfx, which I changed because it was stillGfx
When it should be stillgfx

Read full topic
